alert.note: Alert for Spink (South Dakota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Aberdeen (Northern and Northeastern South Dakota)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 19 at 12:19AM MDT until further notice by NWS Aberdeen
info.description: ...Forecast flooding changed from Moderate to Major severity for the following rivers in South Dakota... James River at Ashton affecting Spink County. .For sites with a river forecast, the forecast includes precipitation through the next 24 hours. Any future precipitation could affect the forecasts. ...FLOOD WARNING FOR SNOWMELT REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Major flooding is occurring and major flooding is forecast. * WHERE...James River at Ashton. * WHEN...Until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 16.5 feet, water overtops the bridge 3 miles north and 1 1/2 mile east of Ashton. At 19.0 feet, water reaches the bottom of the bridge 2 miles south and 1 mile east of Ashton. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1:01 AM CDT Wednesday the stage was 16.7 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 1:01 AM CDT Wednesday was 16.7 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 18.3 feet this evening. - Flood stage is 13.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/abr. The next statement will be issued Wednesday morning.
